description: Patroni dashboard for pgSCV metrics (Prometheus version, pgSCV 0.8.4 edition)

panels.description: Current status of Patroni service.
panels.title: Status

panels.description: Patroni node name.
panels.title: Node name

panels.description: Patroni version.
panels.title: Version

panels.description: Patroni node status (Leader or Follower).
panels.title: Node status

panels.description: Patroni cluster lock status.
panels.title: Cluster lock

panels.description:
Patroni pause or resume mode for the cluster.

See docs https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/master/pause.html for more info.
panels.title: Pause/Resume mode

panels.description: Epoch timestamp when DCS was last contacted successfully by Patroni.
panels.title: DCS last seen

panels.description: Epoch seconds since latest timeline switched.
panels.title: Latest timeline switched

panels.description: Is replica.
panels.title: Replica

panels.description: Is standby leader.
panels.title: Standby leader

panels.description: Is 1 if the replaying of Postgres transaction log is paused, 0 otherwise.
panels.title: Replay paused

panels.description:
DCS Failsafe Mode.

See docs https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/master/dcs_failsafe_mode.html for more info.
panels.title: DCS failsafe mode

panels.description:
The number of seconds the loop will sleep.

Rule: loop_wait + 2 * retry_timeout <= ttl

See loop_wait settings in docs https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dynamic_configuration.html for more info.
panels.title: Loop wait

panels.description:
Timeout for DCS and PostgreSQL operation retries (in seconds).

Rule: loop_wait + 2 * retry_timeout <= ttl

See retry_timeout settings in docs https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dynamic_configuration.html for more info.
panels.title: Retry timeout

panels.description:
The TTL to acquire the leader lock (in seconds).

Rule: loop_wait + 2 * retry_timeout <= ttl

See ttl settings in docs https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dynamic_configuration.html for more info.
panels.title: TTL

panels.description:
The maximum bytes a follower may lag to be able to participate in leader election.

See maximum_lag_on_failover settings in docs https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/dynamic_configuration.html
panels.title: Max lag on failover

panels.description: Is 1 if Postgres is running, 0 otherwise.
panels.title: PostgreSQL running

panels.description: PostgreSQL uptime.
panels.title: PostgreSQL uptime

panels.description: Is 1 if the node needs a restart, 0 otherwise.
panels.title: PostgreSQL pending restart

panels.description: PostgreSQL timeline.
panels.title: PostgreSQL timeline

panels.description: PostgreSQL version.
panels.title: PostgreSQL version

panels.description: Is 1 if Postgres is streaming, 0 otherwise.
panels.title: PostgreSQL streaming

panels.description: Is 1 if Postgres is replicating from archive, 0 otherwise.
panels.title: PostgreSQL is archive recovery

panels.description:
Is 1 if synchronous mode is active, 0 if inactive.

See docs https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/replication_modes.html#synchronous-mode for more info.
panels.title: PostgreSQL synchronous standby

panels.description: Current location of the Postgres transaction log, 0 if this node is a replica.
panels.title: Primary WAL location

panels.description: Current location of the received Postgres transaction log, 0 if this node is the leader.
panels.title: Replica received WAL location

panels.description: Current location of the replayed Postgres transaction log, 0 if this node is the leader.
panels.title: Replica replayed WAL location

panels.description: Current timestamp of the replayed Postgres transaction log, 0 if null.
panels.title: Replica replayed WAL timestamp

title: pgSCV: Patroni
